article.text:
{{about|the defunct 2011-2012 automobile|the new production version|Karma Revero|the company that produces the new production version|Karma Automotive}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2014}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Fisker Karma | image = Fisker at speed in the fog trimmed.jpg | aka = | manufacturer = [[Fisker Automotive]] | production = 2011–2012 | assembly = [[Uusikaupunki]], [[Finland]] by [[Valmet Automotive]] | class = [[Full-size car|Full-size]] [[Luxury vehicle|luxury car]] | body_style = 4-door [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]] | layout = [[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, rear-wheel drive]] | related = {{Unbulleted list| [[#Fisker Surf|Fisker Surf]] | [[#Fisker Sunset|Fisker Sunset]] | [[VLF Destino]] | [[Karma Revero]] }} | platform = | engine = 2.0 L (121.9 cu in) turbocharged Ecotec VVT DI [[GM Ecotec engine#LNF|LNF]] [[Inline-four engine|I4]] | motor = two {{convert|120|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} motors, 479 N·m torque each | battery = {{convert|20.1|kWh|MJ|1|abbr=on}} [[lithium-ion battery]] | range = {{convert|230|mi|abbr=on}} | electric_range = {{convert|32|mi|abbr=on}} ([[United States Environmental Protection Agency|EPA]])
{{convert|83|km|abbr=on}} ([[Technischer Überwachungsverein|TÜV]]) | drivetrain = [[Hybrid vehicle drivetrain#Series hybrid|Series hybrid]]. The two electric motors drive the rear wheels through a [[limited-slip differential]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.fiskerautomotive.com/Content/pdf/Fisker_Karma_Specs.pdf|title=datasheet|access-date=2011-10-25|work=fiskerautomotive.com}} | transmission = 1-speed | charging = 3.3 kW (220 V 15 A as for UK) on-board charger on IEC Type 1 inlet (SAE-J1772-2009) | wheelbase ={{convert|124.4|in|mm|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|195.67|in|mm|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|78.11|in|mm|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|51.57|in|mm|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|5300|lb|abbr=on}} | designer = [[Henrik Fisker]] | predecessor = | successor = [[Karma Revero]] }} The '''Fisker Karma''' was a premium plug-in [[Range extender (vehicle)|range-extended electric]]{{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/car-news/used-2012-fisker-karma-prices-take-a-plunge.html|title=Used 2012 Fisker Karma Prices Take a Plunge - Edmunds.com|publisher=}} [[luxury vehicle|luxury]] [[sports sedan]] produced by [[Fisker Automotive]] in 2012. The cars were manufactured at [[Valmet Automotive]] in Finland.{{cite web|url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/News/NewsArticle.aspx?AR=258134|title=Fisker Karma gets 3000 orders|author=Jim Holder|date=12 July 2011|publisher=[[Autocar (magazine)|Autocar]]|access-date=2011-07-12}} The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] (EPA) rated the Karma's combined city/highway [[fuel economy in automobiles|fuel economy]] at {{convert|52|mpgus|abbr=on}} [[miles per gallon gasoline equivalent|equivalent (MPG-e)]] in [[Charge-depleting|all-electric mode]], and at {{convert|20|mpgus|abbr=on}} in gasoline-only mode. EPA's official [[all-electric range]] is {{convert|32|mi|abbr=on}}. Due to the very small cabin interior volume, the EPA rated the Fisker Karma as a [[subcompact car]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytech.com/Fisker+Karma+EPA+Rated+Subcompact+Despite+Large+Size/article23141.htm |title=Fisker Karma EPA Rated Subcompact Despite Large Size |author=Tiffany Kaiser|publisher=Daily Tech|date=28 October 2011|access-date=2011-12-14}} The first deliveries took place in the U.S. in late July 2011,{{cite news|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2010/05/27/fisker-karma-full-production-delayed-to-february-2011/|title=Fisker Karma full production delayed to February 2011|publisher=green.autoblog.com|author=Reuters|date=27 May 2010|access-date=2011-06-10}}{{cite news|url=http://www.topspeed.com/cars/car-news/fisker-karma-has-been-delayed-yet-again-for-july-2011-ar110709.html|title=Fisker Karma Has Been Delayed Yet Again For July 2011|work=Top Speed|date=5 June 2001|access-date=2011-06-10}} and deliveries to retail customers began in November 2011. Pricing in the U.S. started at {{US$|102,000}} for the base model (EcoStandard), US$110,000 for the intermediate EcoSport model and {{US$|116,000}} for the top model (the "Animal Free" EcoChic). Around 1,800 units were delivered in North America and Europe through December 2012. The U.S. was the leading market, with about 1,600 units sold. Production was suspended in November 2012 when the sole battery supplier to [[Fisker Automotive]], [[A123 Systems]], filed for bankruptcy following two battery recalls. [[Fisker Automotive]] was unable to carry on production of the Fisker Karma in the absence of its sole battery supplier,{{cite news|url=http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/03/13/henrik-fisker-resigns-from-fisker-automotive/|title=Henrik Fisker Resigns From Fisker Automotive|author=Bradley Berman|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=13 March 2013|access-date=2013-06-18}} with about 2,450 Karmas built since 2011.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/06/17/us-autos-fisker-specialreport-idUSBRE95G02L20130617|title=Special Report: Bad Karma: How Fisker burned through $1.4 billion on a 'green' car|author= Deepa Seetharaman and Paul Lienert|work=[[Reuters]]|date=17 June 2013|access-date=2013-06-18}} After [[furlough]]ing its US workers in late March 2013,{{cite news|last=Blanco|first=Sebastian |title=Fisker furloughs workers for one week, says it is 'common practice' in industry |url=http://green.autoblog.com/2013/03/28/fisker-furlough-workers-one-week/ |access-date=2013-04-02 |newspaper=green.autoblog.com |date=31 March 2013}} Fisker Automotive filed for bankruptcy in November 2013, after the [[United States Department of Energy]] auctioned its debt and sold it to Hybrid Technology LLC for {{US$|25 million}}.{{cite news|url=http://washpost.bloomberg.com/Story?docId=1376-MV72XN1A1I4H01-6GLSGU1FDLTFU76TRRFLUMVJTV|title=Fisker Selling Assets to Li Group at $139 Million Loss to U.S.|author=Angela Greiling Keane|work=Bloomberg |publisher=[[The Washington Post]]|date=23 November 2013|access-date=2013-11-23}} Following the sale of some of the assets of the company, the designs, rights to a plug-hybrid powertrain and a manufacturing facility in Delaware to the Chinese company [[Wanxiang]], the new owners re-commenced production in September 2016 under the brand name Karma Automotive.{{cite web|title=Fisker and new Chinese owner to restart Karma production this year|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/02/24/us-china-autos-fisker-idUSBREA1N06K20140224|website=Reuters|access-date=4 August 2014|date=24 February 2014}} After several announcements by the Wanxiang Group to reintroduce an upgraded version of the Fisker Karma, the car has been renamed the '''[[Karma Revero]]''' and it will be launched with booking scheduled to begin in September 2016.{{cite web|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/fisker-karma-back-karma-revero-144539955.html|title=Fisker Karma back as Karma Revero, complete with solar roof|publisher=|access-date=11 August 2016}} ==History== The Fisker Karma was revealed at the 2008 [[North American International Auto Show]] in Detroit.{{cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2008/01/14/the-eco-chic-fisker-karma-and-150mpg-xh-150-hybrids-revealed/ |title=The "eco-chic" Fisker Karma and 150mpg XH-150 hybrids revealed |access-date=2008-01-14 |last=Ricker |first=Thomas |date=14 January 2008 |work=[[Engadget]] |publisher=[[Weblogs, Inc.]] }} It is the first car from [[Fisker Automotive]], a new auto maker based in Anaheim, California, founded on 5 September 2007.{{cite news | title=Drive the Future with Fisker Automotive, A New Green American Premium Car Company | date=5 September 2007 |url=http://www.fiskerautomotive.com/pdf/FISKER%20AUTOMOTIVE%20-%20English.pdf |format=PDF |publisher=[[Fisker Automotive]] |access-date=2009-09-14}} Production began in July 2011, and the first two deliveries took place in the United States on 26 July 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/energy/detail?entry_id=94012|title=Meet the Karma|author=David R. Baker|work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]]| date=26 July 2011| access-date=2011-07-27}}{{cite web|url=http://gigaom.com/cleantech/photos-kleiners-ray-lane-receives-his-fisker-karma/|title=PHOTOS: Kleiner's Ray Lane receives his Fisker Karma|author=Katie Fehrenbacher|publisher=earth2tech|date=26 July 2011|access-date=2011-07-26}} In October 2011 the first Karma delivered in the UK was auctioned to benefit [[Pratham|Pratham UK]] and raised a bid of {{GBP|140,000}} (around {{US$|220,000}}).{{cite web|url=http://www.carsuk.net/first-fisker-karma-in-the-uk-auctioned-for-140k/|title=First Fisker Karma in the UK auctioned for £140k|publisher=Cars UK|date=13 October 2010|access-date=2010-10-17}} Following the sale to Chinese company Wanxiang of assets, designs, rights to a plug-hybrid powertrain, and a manufacturing facility in Delaware, the new owners in September 2016 commenced production under the name Karma Automotive. After several announcements by Wanxiang Group to reintroduce an upgraded version of the ''Fisker Karma'', it has been renamed the [[Karma Revero]] and {{As of|September 2016|alt=launched with booking scheduled then too}}. ==Specifications== [[File:2012 Fisker EVer Karma EC.jpg|thumb|Fisker EVer Karma (US)]] The Karma is a [[Range extender (vehicle)|range-extended electric vehicle]] or [[series hybrid]] driven by a pair of {{convert|120|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} electric motors that receive power from a 20.1 [[kWh]] [[lithium ion battery]] supplied by [[A123 Systems]] and/or an engine powered generator. The battery pack runs down the center of the car, between the pairs of left-hand and right-hand seats, preventing a rear bench and seating four rather than five passengers. Once the battery is depleted, or when the driver activates the "Sport" paddle on the steering wheel, the front-mounted 260-hp, 2.0-liter [[Ecotec]] [[Inline-four engine|four-cylinder]] direct-injection [[Turbocharger|turbocharged]] gasoline engine powers a generator that sends electricity directly to the drive motors. The engine is sourced from [[General Motors]].{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2012/02/28/2012-fisker-karma-second-drive-review-2/|title=2012 Fisker Karma (w/video) – A Genuinely Good Idea That's Compromised By Design |author=Damon Lavrinc|publisher=green.autoblog.com| date=28 February 2012| access-date=2012-03-19}}{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarreports.com/overview/fisker_karma_2012| title=2012 Fisker Karma -Review| author=John Voelcker|publisher=Green Car Reports| date=13 March 2012|access-date=2012-03-19}} The battery can also be charged from the grid, making the vehicle a type of [[Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicle|plug-in hybrid electric vehicle]] (PHEV). The Karma's engine is mated with a generator to provide an electrical connection to the motors and also recharge the batteries, and as such the electric motors are the only mechanical driving force connected to the wheels. However, in [[all-electric mode]], the Karma is around half as efficient as the [[Chevrolet Volt]]. The proprietary Q-Drive hybrid drive train is supplied by Quantum Technologies, which operates in a joint venture with Fisker Coachbuild known as Fisker Automotive.{{cite web|url=http://www.qtww.com/automotive-fisker|title=Quantum and the Fisker Karma|publisher=Quantum Technologies|access-date=21 July 2011}} The Karma's [[curb weight]] is {{convert|5300|lb|kg|abbr=on}}. The Karma includes as standard{{cite web |url=http://www.motorauthority.com/blog/1052864_fisker-hikes-prices-on-karma-sales-launch-spring-2011 |publisher=MotorAuthority.com |first=Nelson |last=Ireson |date=23 December 2010 |access-date=2011-01-11 |title=Fisker Hikes Price on Karma, Sales Launch Summer 2011 }} a solar paneled roof manufactured by Asola Advanced and Automotive Solar Systems GmbH, a Quantum Technologies affiliate,{{cite web|url=http://www.qtww.com/energy-asola|access-date=2011-07-21|title=Products/Services: ENERGY – Asola GmbH|publisher=Asola GmbH}} to aid the cabin climate control system. The solar roof is capable of generating a half kilowatt-hour a day{{cite web |url=http://www.autotrader.com/research/article/auto-show/37173/fisker-karma.jsp |publisher=AutoTrader.com |first=Matthew |last=de Paula |date=27 February 2009 |access-date=2009-09-14 |title=Fisker Karma }} and was estimated to provide up to {{convert|4|to(-)|5|mi}} of additional range a week assuming continuously sunny days;{{cite web |url=http://www.cars.com/go/features/autoshows/vehicle.jsp?vehicletype=production&autoshowyear=2009&vehicle=production_fisker_karma&make=Fisker&model=Karma |title=2010 Fisker Karma |author=David |date=12 January 2009 |access-date=2009-09-14 |publisher=cars.com }} however, the solar panels as delivered only recharge the 12-volt lead-acid accessory battery.{{Cite AV media | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=moFQhZ0_-TU?t=13m30s | title=Car and Driver: Tested : 2012 Fisker Karma – Review – CAR and DRIVER | publisher=Car and Driver magazine | date=31 October 2012 | people=Csere, Csaba | authorlink = Csaba Csere | time=13m30s | location=Beverly Hills, CA}} The base model features an "eco-friendly interior", including salvaged/reclaimed [[lumber]]. The interior space is rated as subcompact by the EPA.{{cite web | url=http://news.consumerreports.org/cars/2012/04/fisker-shows-smaller-atlantic-plug-in-hybrid-sedan-in-ny.html | title=Fisker shows smaller Atlantic plug-in hybrid sedan in NY | publisher=[[Consumer Reports]] | work=Consumer News – web | date=6 April 2012 | access-date=14 February 2013 | author=Evarts, Eric}} Optional leather seating is available, but it will use much more of the cow hide than would customarily be found on luxury models; hides with scratches and other marks (which should not affect functionality) will be used.{{cite web |url=http://www.thecarconnection.com/marty-blog/1016887_2010-fisker-karma-vegan-on-board |title=2010 Fisker Karma: Vegan On Board |author=Bengt Halvorson |publisher=thecarconnection.com |date=19 January 2009 |access-date=2011-03-06}} The EcoChic features a natural fabric interior with an ultra-suede dash, as part of Fisker's ecological "animal-free" offering. The Karma has a [[Electric vehicle warning sounds|warning sound system]] designed to both alert pedestrians of its presence and enhance the driver experience. The sound is emitted through a pair of external speakers embedded in the bumper, and the sound-generator was developed by Fisker Automotive.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/14/automobiles/14hybrid.html?_r=2|title=Hybrid Cars May Include Fake Vroom for Safety|publisher=[[New York Times]]|author=Jim Motavalli| date=13 October 2009| access-date=2013-03-21}}{{cite news| url=http://www.economist.com/science/displaystory.cfm?story_id=13606446|title=Electric cars and noise: The sound of silence|publisher=The Economist|date=7 May 2009|access-date=2013-03-21}} The warning sound is emitted automatically and activated only when the car is traveling in [[all-electric mode]] at less than {{convert|25|mph|abbr=on}}.{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/jan/08/autos/la-fi-hy-autos-dot-noise-rules-hybrid-electric-vehicles-20130108 |title=Noise requirements proposed for hybrid and electric vehicles |author=David Undercoffler|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=8 January 2013|access-date=2013-03-21}} ===Performance=== The Karma's two {{convert|201|bhp|PS}} motors produce {{convert|1300|Nm}} of torque, giving the Karma a quoted horsepower of 403 HP.{{cite web |url=http://www.automoblog.net/2009/01/16/detroit-2009-production-fisker-karma-sedan/ |title=Detroit 2009: Production Fisker Karma is revealed, jaws begin dropping |author=Will |date=16 January 2009 |publisher=AutomoBlog |access-date=2009-12-03}}{{cite web |url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/fuel-efficiency/hybrid-technology/fisker-karma2.htm |title=Fisker Karma: Plenty of Torque and Voltage, Too |author=Eric Baxter |date= |publisher=howstuffworks |access-date=2009-12-03}} The Karma features a {{convert|125|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}} top speed and is capable of reaching {{convert|60|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} from a standstill in 6.3 seconds.{{cite web|url=http://whatismycar.com/info/16540/|title=Fisker Karma Technical Specifications|date=21 February 2012}} ==Fuel economy and range== [[File:Fisker Karma EPA label.jpg|thumb|[[Monroney label]] showing EPA's fuel economy and environmental comparison label for the 2012 Fisker Karma]] The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|Environmental Protection Agency]] (EPA) official all-electric range for the Fisker Karma is {{convert|32|mi|abbr=on}} under the agency's five-cycle tests using varying driving conditions and climate controls. EPA's estimated energy consumption is 65 [[kWh]] per 100 miles (1462 [[kilojoule|kJ]]/km). The total range with a full tank of gasoline and a fully charged battery is {{convert|230|mi}}. EPA's official rating for combined city/highway [[fuel economy in automobiles|fuel economy]] in [[all-electric mode]] is 52 [[miles per gallon gasoline equivalent]] (MPG-e) (4.5 L gasoline equivalent/100 km; 62 mpg-imp gasoline equivalent). The EPA rating in gasoline-only mode is {{convert|20|mpgus|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2011/10/karma-20111020.html |title=Fisker Karma EPA-rated at 65 kWh/100 miles on electricity, with 32-mile electric range and 20 mpg US on gasoline|publisher=Green Car Congress|date=20 October 2011|access-date=2011-10-20}} Regarding EPA's rating [[Henrik Fisker]], CEO and co-founder of Fisker Automotive commented that "...as with all electric vehicles, range varies greatly on the conditions of the road and how you drive the car. We firmly believe that most owners will get up to 50 miles of driving range on a single charge."{{cite web|url=http://www.autoguide.com/auto-news/2011/10/fisker-karma-gets-52-mpge-fuel-economy-rating.html|title=Fisker Karma Gets 52 MPGe Fuel Economy Rating|author= Colum Wood|publisher=Auto Guide|date=19 October 2011|access-date=2011-10-19}} The German [[Technischer Überwachungsverein|Technical Inspection Association]] (TÜV) found through independent tests that the Fisker Karma has an all-electric range of {{convert|83|km|abbr=on}} in stealth (all-electric) mode. TÜV found that in [[charge-sustaining]] sport mode the Karma achieves a fuel economy of 26 mpg (9.2 l/100 km). The combined fuel economy was rated at 112 MPG-e (2.1 l/100 km equivalent) and the emissions level is 51 g/km CO2.{{cite web|url=http://www.autoobserver.com/2011/11/fisker-karma-claims-516-mile-electric-range.html|title=Fisker Karma Claims 51.6-Mile Electric Range|author=Scott Doggett|publisher=Edmunds Auto Observer| date=7 November 2011| access-date=2011-11-10}} ''See details in Press Release.''{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2011/11/21/fisker-karma-gets-rated-at-112-mpg-from-europes-tuv/#continued|title=Fisker Karma gets rated at 112 mpg from Europe's TUV|author=Fisker Automotive|publisher=green.autoblog.com|date=21 November 2011|access-date=2011-11-25}} ''See details in Press Release.'' ==Production and delivery== Fisker Automotive and [[Valmet Automotive]] reached agreement in 2008 to manufacture the Karma in [[Uusikaupunki]], [[Finland]],{{cite news | url =http://www.hs.fi/talous/artikkeli/Hybridit+korvaamassa+Porschen+Uudessakaupungissa/1135237888298 | title = Hybridit korvaamassa Porschen | date =15 July 2008 | access-date =2008-07-16 |language=Finnish |newspaper=[[Helsingin Sanomat]]}} with the final assembly contract signed by both parties on 13 November 2008.{{cite web | url = http://www.automotive.com/auto-news/02/39938/index.html | title = Fisker Automotive and Valmet Automotive Have Signed Final Assembly Contract for the... | date = 13 November 2008 | access-date = 2008-11-13 }} [[File:Fisker Karma Interior.JPG|thumb|right|Interior]] In 2008 Fisker Automotive began accepting [[pre-order]]s in the United States, and Europe and initially scheduled sales of its Karma PHEV by the fourth quarter of 2009 in the United States, and starting in 2010 in Europe.{{cite web |url = http://www.autoindustry.co.uk/news/11-04-08_11 |title = Fisker Automotive announces first European importer |date = 11 April 2008 |access-date = 2009-09-14 |publisher = [[Department for Business, Enterprise and Regulatory Reform]] |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://archive.is/20080415000848/http://www.autoindustry.co.uk/news/11-04-08_11 |archivedate = 15 April 2008 |df = dmy-all }} In 2009 Henrik Fisker reported 1,300 orders for the Karma.{{cite web |url=http://www.treehugger.com/files/2009/01/detroit-2009-fisker-automotive-karma-s-sunset-convertible.php |title=Detroit Auto Show 2009: Fisker Unveils Karma S Convertible Plug-In Hybrid |author=Michael Graham Richard |publisher=[[TreeHugger]] |date=11 March 2009 |access-date=2011-03-16}} Henrik Fisker showed the first production model Karma at the 2010 [[Paris Motor Show]].{{cite web |url=http://blogs.edmunds.com/greencaradvisor/2010/09/2010-paris-motor-show-fisker-karma-production-model-hews-to-concepts-promise.html |title=2010 Paris Motor Show: Fisker Karma Production Model Hews to Concept's Promise |author=John O'Dell |date=30 September 2010 |work=Green Car Adviser |publisher=[[Edmunds.com]] |access-date=2010-12-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101004165018/http://blogs.edmunds.com/greencaradvisor/2010/09/2010-paris-motor-show-fisker-karma-production-model-hews-to-concepts-promise.html |archivedate=4 October 2010 |df=dmy-all }} In July 2011, Fisker stated that it had received 3,000 pre-orders and that the plug-in hybrid was sold out until early 2012. After re-scheduling the Karma market launch to September 2010, and missing its target to build 70 to 100 test cars in 2010,{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE64Q11G20100527#|title=Fisker to build 100 test Karma cars in 2010|author=Poornima Gupta| publisher=[[Reuters]]| date=27 May 2010|access-date=2011-03-07}} production began in July 2011, and the two first deliveries took place in the United States during the same month. The [[Valmet Automotive|Valmet plant]] in Finland began production with five cars a week. By December 2011 the production rate was 25 units a day.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-12-22/fisker-seeks-to-lift-karma-sales-to-move-on-from-loan-scrutiny.html|title=Fisker Automotive Seeks to Lift Karma Sales to Move on From Loan Scrutiny|author=Alan Ohnsman|publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]|date=22 December 2011|access-date=2012-01-04}} Production was suspended in November 2012 due to financial difficulties, with about 2,450 Karmas built since 2011. As a result of [[flash flood]]s caused by [[Hurricane Sandy]] in October 2012, 16 Karmas caught fire and another 330 units were lost when an entire shipment from Europe was flooded while being parked at [[Port Newark–Elizabeth Marine Terminal]]. Deliveries to retail customers in the U.S. began in November 2011.{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2011/10/19/fisker-karma-epa-certified-52-mpge-32-mile-electric-range/|title=Fisker Karma gets EPA certified: 52 mpge, 32-mile electric range then 20 mpg|author=Fisker Automotive (press release)|publisher=green.autoblog.com|date=19 October 2011|access-date=2011-10-19}} ''See details in Press Release''. In the United States the first vehicles were sold for {{US$|95,900}} for the basic model, and {{US$|109,850}} for the top model.{{cite web|author=Godske, Bjørn|url=http://ing.dk/artikel/115212-fiskers-danske-hybridbil-klar-til-salg-om-to-maaneder|language=Danish|title=Fisker's hybrid for sale in two months|publisher=Ing.dk|date=3 January 2011|access-date=4 January 2011}} In December 2011 prices were raised to {{US$|102,000}} for the base EcoStandard model, and {{US$|116,000}} for the top model, the EcoChic.{{cite web|author=[[Fox News]]|url=http://www.green.autoblog.com/2011/12/13/fisker-hikes-karma-price-again-now-above-100k/|title=Fisker hikes Karma price... again... now above $100k|publisher=green.autoblog.com|date=13 December 2011|access-date=December 13, 2011}} ;Retail sales Over 2,000 Karmas were delivered to customers in North America and Europe through December 2012, of which, around 200 were delivered in 2011 and approximately 1,800 in 2012. About 1,600 units were sold in the United States through December 2013.{{cite web| url=http://www.hybridcars.com/top-6-plug-in-car-adopting-countries/7/ | title=Top 6 Plug-In Vehicle Adopting Countries| first=Jeff | last=Cobb| publisher=HybridCars.com| date=2014-01-16| access-date=2016-08-29}} ''Around 1,800 Tesla Roadsters and 1,600 Fisker Karmas had been sold in the U.S. by the end of 2013.'' A total of 533 units were sold in Europe through December 2014. The Netherlands was the top selling European market for the Karma, with 166 units sold through June 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.raivereniging.nl/markt-informatie/statistieken/verkoopstatistieken.aspx |title=Verkoopstatistieken -nieuwverkoop personenautos |language=Dutch |trans-title=Sales Statistics – New passenger car sales |author=RAI |publisher=RAI Vereniging |date= |access-date=2013-07-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328183047/http://www.raivereniging.nl/markt-informatie/statistieken/verkoopstatistieken.aspx |archivedate=28 March 2014 |df=dmy }} ''Download PDF file for detailed sales in 2011 ("Download nieuwverkoop personenautos 201112"), 2012 ("Download nieuwverkoop personenautos 201212") and 2013 ("Download nieuwverkoop personenautos 201304")''.{{cite web|url=http://www.autoweek.nl/verkoopcijfers.php?verkoopjaar=2013&maand=6|title=Verkoopcijfers juni 2013 -Modellenoverzicht|language=Dutch|trans-title=Sales June 2013-Models overview|author=RAI|publisher=Auto Week Netherlands|date=July 2013|access-date=2013-07-04}} ''Table shows May and June 2013 sales''. Fisker collected nearly US$200 million until February 2012, when the government froze the loan, because the company was failing to meet the government's milestones. Three months later, in May, Fisker spokesman Robert Ormisher told ABC News that negotiations with the DOE were ongoing, and "We're hoping for a conclusion fairly soon."{{cite news|author= Randy Kreider|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/fisker-recalls-electric-cars/story?id=17044981#.UJKQh7RgPlI|title=Fisker Issues Second Recall of Electric Car|date=12 August 2012|access-date=2012-11-01}} ===''Top Gear''=== The Karma was praised on the British television series ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'' for its looks and hybrid technology while being road-tested by presenter [[James May]] and special guest, [[AC/DC]] front-man [[Brian Johnson]]. Johnson noted that it is probably one of the first production cars that actually looks like the [[concept car|concept version]] that is sketched beforehand, saying, "It's a cracking looking jam-jar". May noticed similarities in the hybrid-powertrain to his own idea that was used in a segment for ''Top Gear'' a few years earlier (The ''Hammerhead Eagle i-Thrust''), though he admits that his idea was very crudely executed. He joked that Fisker would be hearing soon from his lawyers. After his test of the Karma EcoChic, James May awarded it his Top Gear "Car of the Year Award" for 2011[https://www.topgear.com/car-news/usa/tg-awards-2011-james-mays-car-year TG Awards 2011: James May's car of the year]. ==Recalls== In December 2011, Fisker recalled the first 239 Karmas built from July through 3 November 2011, and delivered to the USA, due to a risk of battery fire caused by coolant leak. Of the 239 cars, fewer than fifty had been delivered to customers, the rest were in dealerships, and at that time no car had been involved in a fire. In the report filed by Fisker Automotive with the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA), the carmaker said some hose clamps were not properly positioned, which could allow a coolant leak. "If coolant enters the battery compartment an electrical short could possibly occur, causing a thermal event within the battery, including a possible fire in the [worst] case." The problem was discovered on 16 December at the Valmet Automotive assembly plant in Finland when workers noticed coolant dripping.{{cite news|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/article/20111230/AUTO01/112300333/1148/rss25|title=Fisker recalls plug-in hybrids; EV safety concerns revived |author=David Shepardson|work=[[The Detroit News]]|date=30 December 2011|access-date=2012-01-15}}{{cite news|author= Allan Graubæk|url=http://politiken.dk/tjek/ECE1493453/fiskers-luksusbil-kaldt-retur-i-usa/|title=Fisker's luxury car recalled in USA|work=Politiken|date=30 December 2011|access-date=2011-12-30|language=Danish}}{{cite news|url= http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/12/30/fisker-recalling-239-karma-electric-cars-for-fire-hazard/?ref=automobiles|title=Fisker Recalling 239 Karma Plug-In Hybrids for Fire Hazard |author=Christopher Jensen|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=30 December 2011|access-date=2012-01-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.car-recall.com/Fisker/Karma/2012/92961?|title=2012 Fisker Karma Recall|date=28 December 2011}} On 2 January 2012, Fisker announced that most customer cars and cars stocked in dealerships affected by the recall involving [[A123 Systems]]-supplied battery packs are back in service. The vehicles have either had brand new battery packs installed or the confirmed repair to the hose clamp assembly undertaken. The remaining customers have been contacted and appointments were made for their replacement battery installation.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/01/fisker-20120203.html|title=Fisker says majority of Karma units affected by recall involving battery pack back in service|author=Fisker Press Release|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=3 January 2012|access-date=2012-01-15}} On 18 August 2012, Fisker announced it is recalling about 2,400 Karma plug-in hybrids to repair a faulty cooling fan unit.{{cite news|last=Seetharaman|first=Deepa|title=Automaker Fisker recalls some 2,400 Karmas for cooling fan issue|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/18/us-fisker-karma-idUSBRE87H08H20120818|work=Reuters|access-date=2012-08-18|date= 18 August 2012}} ===''Consumer Reports'' test drive=== On 7 March 2012, a Fisker Karma purchased for US$107,850 by ''[[Consumer Reports]]'' magazine was taken out for a test drive at the {{convert|327|acre|ha|adj=on}} ''CR'' test track facility in Connecticut. The Karma had fewer than {{convert|200|mi|km}} on its odometer. While performing a routine speedometer calibration check prior to actual road testing, the car broke down and could not be restarted. "We buy about 80 cars a year and this is the first time in memory that we have had a car that is undriveable before it has finished our check-in process."{{cite news|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/driveon/post/2012/03/consumer-reports-fisker-karma-breaks/1|title=Consumer Reports' $100K Fisker Karma dies on arrival|author=James R. Retrieved 27 March 2012. ===Fire incidents=== {{See also|Plug-in electric vehicle fire incidents}} A Fisker Karma was involved in a home fire that also burned two other cars in [[Fort Bend County, Texas]] in May 2012. The chief fire investigator said the Karma was the origin of the fire that spread to the house, but the exact cause is still unknown. The [[plug-in electric car]] was not plugged in at the time the fire started and it was reported that the Karma's battery was intact. The carmaker released a public statement saying that there was uncertainty and conflicting reports surrounding the event. Fisker Automotive also stated that the battery pack "does not appear to have been a contributing factor in this incident."{{cite news| url=http://www.autoweek.com/article/20120508/CARNEWS/120509860| title=Official claims Fisker Karma to blame in Texas house fire|author=David Arnouts|work=[[Autoweek]]|date=8 May 2012|access-date=2012-05-09}} The NHTSA is conducting a field inquiry of the incident, and is working with insurance adjusters and Fisker to determine the fire's cause.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-05-18/fisker-karma-fire-in-texas-garage-being-probed-by-nhtsa.html|title=Fisker Karma Fire in Texas Garage Being Probed By NHTSA|author=Angela Greiling Keane|work=[[Bloomberg L.P.]] News|date=18 May 2012|access-date=2012-05-23}} A second fire incident took place in August 2012 when a Karma caught fire while stopped at a parking lot in [[Woodside, California]].{{cite web|last=Lavrinc|first=Damon|title=Another Fisker Karma Goes Up in Flames|url=https://www.wired.com/autopia/2012/08/fisker-karma-fire-part-deux/|publisher=Wired Autopia|date=11 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-12}}{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarreports.com/news/1078412_second-fisker-karma-fire-casts-fresh-doubt-on-plug-in-hybrid|title=Second Fisker Karma Fire Casts Fresh Doubt on Plug-In Hybrid |author=John Voelcker|publisher=Green Car Reports|date=13 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-13}} According to Fisker engineers, the area of origin for the fire was determined to be outside the engine compartment, as the fire was located at the driver's side front corner of the car. The evidence suggested that the ignition source was not the lithium-ion battery pack, new technology components or unique exhaust routing.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/08/fisker-recent-karma-fire-not-caused-by-battery-pack-new-tech-or-exhaust-routing.html|title=Fisker: recent Karma fire not caused by battery pack, new tech or exhaust routing|author=Fisker Automotive Press Release|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=13 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-14}} The investigation conducted by Fisker engineers and an independent fire expert concluded that the cause of the fire was a low temperature cooling fan located at the left front of the Karma, forward of the wheel. An internal fault caused the fan to fail, overheat and started a slow-burning fire. Fisker announced a recall to repair the faulty cooling fan unit.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/08/fisker-20120818.html |title=Fisker: Karma fire caused by fault in low-temperature cooling fan; initiates recall|author=Fisker Automotive|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=18 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-19}} In separate incidents during the storm and flooding caused by [[Hurricane Sandy]] on the night of 29 October 2012, 16 Karmas and one [[Toyota Prius Plug-in Hybrid]] caught fire while parked at [[Port Newark-Elizabeth Marine Terminal]]. The vehicles were partially submerged by [[flash flood]]s caused by the hurricane. Initially, a [[Fisker Automotive]] spokesman said the company "''can't be certain exactly what happened at the port''" but "''we think being submerged in 13 feet of saltwater had something to do with it''". The carmaker clarified that the Karmas were not charging at the time of the fire and there were no injuries. In the case of the Toyota's incident, a Prius PHV burned and two other Prius, a conventional hybrid and a plug-in, just smoldered. A Toyota spokeswoman said the fire "''likely started because saltwater got into the electrical system''". She also clarified that the incident affected only three cars out of the 4,000 Toyotas that were at the terminal during the storm, including more than 2,128 plug-in or hybrid models.{{cite news|url=http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/11/02/mystery-at-port-newark-why-did-17-plug-in-cars-burn/?ef=automobiles|title=Mystery at Port Newark: Why Did 17 Plug-In Cars Burn? |author=Josie Garthwaite|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=2 November 2012|access-date=2012-11-03}}{{cite news|url=http://www.motorauthority.com/news/1080183_fisker-karmas-catch-fire-after-being-submerged-by-hurricane-sandy-flood|title=Fisker Karmas Catch Fire After Being Submerged By Hurricane Sandy Flood|author=Viknesh Vijayenthiran|work=[[Motor Authority]]|date=31 October 2012|access-date=2012-11-03}} After an investigation by Fisker engineers, witnessed by NHTSA representatives, the company said that the origin of the fire was "''residual salt damage inside a Vehicle Control Unit submerged in seawater for several hours. Corrosion from the salt caused a short circuit in the unit, which led to a fire when the Karma's 12-Volt battery fed power into the circuit''". The company explained that Sandy's heavy winds spread that fire to other Karmas parked nearby, and also ruled out the vehicles' lithium-ion battery packs as a cause of, or even a contributing factor to, the blaze.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarreports.com/news/1080276_sandy-flood-fire-followup-fisker-karma-battery-not-at-fault|title=Sandy Flood Fire Followup: Fisker Karma Battery Not At Fault|author=John Voelcker|publisher=Green Car Reports|date=6 November 2012|access-date=2012-11-07}} Fisker reported a loss of around 330 additional Karmas when an entire shipment from Europe was flooded in the port terminal, the estimated value of the flood loss is in excess of {{US$|30}} million.{{cite web|url=http://www.hybridcars.com/news/fisker-exonerated-after-hurricane-induced-karma-330-more-destroyed-59222.ht|title=Hurricane-Induced Fires; Reports 330 More Destroyed|author=Pete Brissette|publisher=hybridcars.com|date=7 November 2012|access-date=2012-11-18}} ===Celebrity crash=== Guitarist [[Carlos Santana]] made the news 20 September 2013 when he wrecked his Fisker Karma in [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]] after falling asleep at the wheel and hitting two parked cars. No one was injured.{{cite web|url=http://www.tmz.com/2013/09/18/carlos-santana-car-crash-accident-las-vegas-fell-asleep-wheel-photo/|title=Carlos Santana's Car Totaled in Vegas Crash -- Asleep at Wheel|publisher=}} ===Tesla lawsuit=== On 14 April 2008, [[Tesla Motors]] filed a lawsuit against Fisker Automotive, alleging that Henrik Fisker stole Tesla's [[Tesla Model S|Model S]] hybrid technology and was using it to develop the Karma. Tesla's suit claimed that the design work done for the Model S sedan by [[Fisker Coachbuild]] was substandard, and that Fisker Automotive diverted its best ideas to the Karma. {{cite news | last = Migliore | first = Greg | title = Tesla sues Fisker, alleges theft of trade secrets | newspaper = [[AutoWeek]] | date = 16 April 2008 | url = http://www.autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/200804161045/FREE/512789873 | access-date = 2008-04-16 }} On 4 November 2008 [[CNET Networks#CNET News|CNET News]] reported that Tesla Motors would discontinue its suit after an interim ruling in favor of Fisker et al. {{cite web | last = LaMonica | first = Martin | title = Tesla Motors loses trade secrets case against Fisker | work = [[CNET Networks#CNET News|CNET News]] | date = 11 April 2008 | url = http://news.cnet.com/8301-11128_3-10082062-54.html?tag=mncol | access-date = 2009-06-29 }} A news release on the Fisker Automotive website stated that Tesla was ordered to pay US$1,144,285 in costs.{{cite web |title=ARBITRATOR FIRM EARLIER FINDING IN FAVOR OF FISKER AND AWARDS FISKER $1,144,385 |publisher=[[Fisker Automotive]] |url=http://karma.fiskerautomotive.com/news_items/download/5/2008-12-11.pdf |format=PDF |access-date=2009-09-14 |date=11 December 2008 }} ==Related models== ==={{anchor|Fisker Sunset}}Fisker Sunset=== [[File:Fisker Sunset--DC.jpg|thumb|Fisker Sunset]] Fisker previewed the Karma S "Sunset", which is based on the regular Karma, at the [[North American International Auto Show|2012 North American International Auto Show]], Fisker has said that the Sunset only has minimum weight increases, when compared with the Karma. text.content:
{{about|the defunct 2011-2012 automobile|the new production version|Karma Revero|the company that produces the new production version|Karma Automotive}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2014}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Fisker Karma | image = Fisker at speed in the fog trimmed.jpg | aka = | manufacturer = [[Fisker Automotive]] | production = 2011–2012 | assembly = [[Uusikaupunki]], [[Finland]] by [[Valmet Automotive]] | class = [[Full-size car|Full-size]] [[Luxury vehicle|luxury car]] | body_style = 4-door [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]] | layout = [[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, rear-wheel drive]] | related = {{Unbulleted list| [[#Fisker Surf|Fisker Surf]] | [[#Fisker Sunset|Fisker Sunset]] | [[VLF Destino]] | [[Karma Revero]] }} | platform = | engine = 2.0 L (121.9 cu in) turbocharged Ecotec VVT DI [[GM Ecotec engine#LNF|LNF]] [[Inline-four engine|I4]] | motor = two {{convert|120|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} motors, 479 N·m torque each | battery = {{convert|20.1|kWh|MJ|1|abbr=on}} [[lithium-ion battery]] | range = {{convert|230|mi|abbr=on}} | electric_range = {{convert|32|mi|abbr=on}} ([[United States Environmental Protection Agency|EPA]])
{{convert|83|km|abbr=on}} ([[Technischer Überwachungsverein|TÜV]]) | drivetrain = [[Hybrid vehicle drivetrain#Series hybrid|Series hybrid]]. The two electric motors drive the rear wheels through a [[limited-slip differential]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.fiskerautomotive.com/Content/pdf/Fisker_Karma_Specs.pdf|title=datasheet|access-date=2011-10-25|work=fiskerautomotive.com}} | transmission = 1-speed | charging = 3.3 kW (220 V 15 A as for UK) on-board charger on IEC Type 1 inlet (SAE-J1772-2009) | wheelbase ={{convert|124.4|in|mm|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|195.67|in|mm|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|78.11|in|mm|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|51.57|in|mm|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|5300|lb|abbr=on}} | designer = [[Henrik Fisker]] | predecessor = | successor = [[Karma Revero]] }} The '''Fisker Karma''' was a premium plug-in [[Range extender (vehicle)|range-extended electric]]{{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/car-news/used-2012-fisker-karma-prices-take-a-plunge.html|title=Used 2012 Fisker Karma Prices Take a Plunge - Edmunds.com|publisher=}} [[luxury vehicle|luxury]] [[sports sedan]] produced by [[Fisker Automotive]] in 2012. The cars were manufactured at [[Valmet Automotive]] in Finland.{{cite web|url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/News/NewsArticle.aspx?AR=258134|title=Fisker Karma gets 3000 orders|author=Jim Holder|date=12 July 2011|publisher=[[Autocar (magazine)|Autocar]]|access-date=2011-07-12}} The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] (EPA) rated the Karma's combined city/highway [[fuel economy in automobiles|fuel economy]] at {{convert|52|mpgus|abbr=on}} [[miles per gallon gasoline equivalent|equivalent (MPG-e)]] in [[Charge-depleting|all-electric mode]], and at {{convert|20|mpgus|abbr=on}} in gasoline-only mode. EPA's official [[all-electric range]] is {{convert|32|mi|abbr=on}}. Due to the very small cabin interior volume, the EPA rated the Fisker Karma as a [[subcompact car]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytech.com/Fisker+Karma+EPA+Rated+Subcompact+Despite+Large+Size/article23141.htm |title=Fisker Karma EPA Rated Subcompact Despite Large Size |author=Tiffany Kaiser|publisher=Daily Tech|date=28 October 2011|access-date=2011-12-14}} The first deliveries took place in the U.S. in late July 2011,{{cite news|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2010/05/27/fisker-karma-full-production-delayed-to-february-2011/|title=Fisker Karma full production delayed to February 2011|publisher=green.autoblog.com|author=Reuters|date=27 May 2010|access-date=2011-06-10}}{{cite news|url=http://www.topspeed.com/cars/car-news/fisker-karma-has-been-delayed-yet-again-for-july-2011-ar110709.html|title=Fisker Karma Has Been Delayed Yet Again For July 2011|work=Top Speed|date=5 June 2001|access-date=2011-06-10}} and deliveries to retail customers began in November 2011. Pricing in the U.S. started at {{US$|102,000}} for the base model (EcoStandard), US$110,000 for the intermediate EcoSport model and {{US$|116,000}} for the top model (the "Animal Free" EcoChic). Around 1,800 units were delivered in North America and Europe through December 2012. The U.S. was the leading market, with about 1,600 units sold. Production was suspended in November 2012 when the sole battery supplier to [[Fisker Automotive]], [[A123 Systems]], filed for bankruptcy following two battery recalls. [[Fisker Automotive]] was unable to carry on production of the Fisker Karma in the absence of its sole battery supplier,{{cite news|url=http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/03/13/henrik-fisker-resigns-from-fisker-automotive/|title=Henrik Fisker Resigns From Fisker Automotive|author=Bradley Berman|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=13 March 2013|access-date=2013-06-18}} with about 2,450 Karmas built since 2011.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/06/17/us-autos-fisker-specialreport-idUSBRE95G02L20130617|title=Special Report: Bad Karma: How Fisker burned through $1.4 billion on a 'green' car|author= Deepa Seetharaman and Paul Lienert|work=[[Reuters]]|date=17 June 2013|access-date=2013-06-18}} After [[furlough]]ing its US workers in late March 2013,{{cite news|last=Blanco|first=Sebastian |title=Fisker furloughs workers for one week, says it is 'common practice' in industry |url=http://green.autoblog.com/2013/03/28/fisker-furlough-workers-one-week/ |access-date=2013-04-02 |newspaper=green.autoblog.com |date=31 March 2013}} Fisker Automotive filed for bankruptcy in November 2013, after the [[United States Department of Energy]] auctioned its debt and sold it to Hybrid Technology LLC for {{US$|25 million}}.{{cite news|url=http://washpost.bloomberg.com/Story?docId=1376-MV72XN1A1I4H01-6GLSGU1FDLTFU76TRRFLUMVJTV|title=Fisker Selling Assets to Li Group at $139 Million Loss to U.S.|author=Angela Greiling Keane|work=Bloomberg |publisher=[[The Washington Post]]|date=23 November 2013|access-date=2013-11-23}} Following the sale of some of the assets of the company, the designs, rights to a plug-hybrid powertrain and a manufacturing facility in Delaware to the Chinese company [[Wanxiang]], the new owners re-commenced production in September 2016 under the brand name Karma Automotive.{{cite web|title=Fisker and new Chinese owner to restart Karma production this year|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/02/24/us-china-autos-fisker-idUSBREA1N06K20140224|website=Reuters|access-date=4 August 2014|date=24 February 2014}} After several announcements by the Wanxiang Group to reintroduce an upgraded version of the Fisker Karma, the car has been renamed the '''[[Karma Revero]]''' and it will be launched with booking scheduled to begin in September 2016.{{cite web|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/fisker-karma-back-karma-revero-144539955.html|title=Fisker Karma back as Karma Revero, complete with solar roof|publisher=|access-date=11 August 2016}} ==History== The Fisker Karma was revealed at the 2008 [[North American International Auto Show]] in Detroit.{{cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2008/01/14/the-eco-chic-fisker-karma-and-150mpg-xh-150-hybrids-revealed/ |title=The "eco-chic" Fisker Karma and 150mpg XH-150 hybrids revealed |access-date=2008-01-14 |last=Ricker |first=Thomas |date=14 January 2008 |work=[[Engadget]] |publisher=[[Weblogs, Inc.]] }} It is the first car from [[Fisker Automotive]], a new auto maker based in Anaheim, California, founded on 5 September 2007.{{cite news | title=Drive the Future with Fisker Automotive, A New Green American Premium Car Company | date=5 September 2007 |url=http://www.fiskerautomotive.com/pdf/FISKER%20AUTOMOTIVE%20-%20English.pdf |format=PDF |publisher=[[Fisker Automotive]] |access-date=2009-09-14}} Production began in July 2011, and the first two deliveries took place in the United States on 26 July 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/energy/detail?entry_id=94012|title=Meet the Karma|author=David R. Baker|work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]]| date=26 July 2011| access-date=2011-07-27}}{{cite web|url=http://gigaom.com/cleantech/photos-kleiners-ray-lane-receives-his-fisker-karma/|title=PHOTOS: Kleiner's Ray Lane receives his Fisker Karma|author=Katie Fehrenbacher|publisher=earth2tech|date=26 July 2011|access-date=2011-07-26}} In October 2011 the first Karma delivered in the UK was auctioned to benefit [[Pratham|Pratham UK]] and raised a bid of {{GBP|140,000}} (around {{US$|220,000}}).{{cite web|url=http://www.carsuk.net/first-fisker-karma-in-the-uk-auctioned-for-140k/|title=First Fisker Karma in the UK auctioned for £140k|publisher=Cars UK|date=13 October 2010|access-date=2010-10-17}} Following the sale to Chinese company Wanxiang of assets, designs, rights to a plug-hybrid powertrain, and a manufacturing facility in Delaware, the new owners in September 2016 commenced production under the name Karma Automotive. After several announcements by Wanxiang Group to reintroduce an upgraded version of the ''Fisker Karma'', it has been renamed the [[Karma Revero]] and {{As of|September 2016|alt=launched with booking scheduled then too}}. ==Specifications== [[File:2012 Fisker EVer Karma EC.jpg|thumb|Fisker EVer Karma (US)]] The Karma is a [[Range extender (vehicle)|range-extended electric vehicle]] or [[series hybrid]] driven by a pair of {{convert|120|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} electric motors that receive power from a 20.1 [[kWh]] [[lithium ion battery]] supplied by [[A123 Systems]] and/or an engine powered generator. The battery pack runs down the center of the car, between the pairs of left-hand and right-hand seats, preventing a rear bench and seating four rather than five passengers. Once the battery is depleted, or when the driver activates the "Sport" paddle on the steering wheel, the front-mounted 260-hp, 2.0-liter [[Ecotec]] [[Inline-four engine|four-cylinder]] direct-injection [[Turbocharger|turbocharged]] gasoline engine powers a generator that sends electricity directly to the drive motors. The engine is sourced from [[General Motors]].{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2012/02/28/2012-fisker-karma-second-drive-review-2/|title=2012 Fisker Karma (w/video) – A Genuinely Good Idea That's Compromised By Design |author=Damon Lavrinc|publisher=green.autoblog.com| date=28 February 2012| access-date=2012-03-19}}{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarreports.com/overview/fisker_karma_2012| title=2012 Fisker Karma -Review| author=John Voelcker|publisher=Green Car Reports| date=13 March 2012|access-date=2012-03-19}} The battery can also be charged from the grid, making the vehicle a type of [[Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicle|plug-in hybrid electric vehicle]] (PHEV). The Karma's engine is mated with a generator to provide an electrical connection to the motors and also recharge the batteries, and as such the electric motors are the only mechanical driving force connected to the wheels. However, in [[all-electric mode]], the Karma is around half as efficient as the [[Chevrolet Volt]]. The proprietary Q-Drive hybrid drive train is supplied by Quantum Technologies, which operates in a joint venture with Fisker Coachbuild known as Fisker Automotive.{{cite web|url=http://www.qtww.com/automotive-fisker|title=Quantum and the Fisker Karma|publisher=Quantum Technologies|access-date=21 July 2011}} The Karma's [[curb weight]] is {{convert|5300|lb|kg|abbr=on}}. The Karma includes as standard{{cite web |url=http://www.motorauthority.com/blog/1052864_fisker-hikes-prices-on-karma-sales-launch-spring-2011 |publisher=MotorAuthority.com |first=Nelson |last=Ireson |date=23 December 2010 |access-date=2011-01-11 |title=Fisker Hikes Price on Karma, Sales Launch Summer 2011 }} a solar paneled roof manufactured by Asola Advanced and Automotive Solar Systems GmbH, a Quantum Technologies affiliate,{{cite web|url=http://www.qtww.com/energy-asola|access-date=2011-07-21|title=Products/Services: ENERGY – Asola GmbH|publisher=Asola GmbH}} to aid the cabin climate control system. The solar roof is capable of generating a half kilowatt-hour a day{{cite web |url=http://www.autotrader.com/research/article/auto-show/37173/fisker-karma.jsp |publisher=AutoTrader.com |first=Matthew |last=de Paula |date=27 February 2009 |access-date=2009-09-14 |title=Fisker Karma }} and was estimated to provide up to {{convert|4|to(-)|5|mi}} of additional range a week assuming continuously sunny days;{{cite web |url=http://www.cars.com/go/features/autoshows/vehicle.jsp?vehicletype=production&autoshowyear=2009&vehicle=production_fisker_karma&make=Fisker&model=Karma |title=2010 Fisker Karma |author=David |date=12 January 2009 |access-date=2009-09-14 |publisher=cars.com }} however, the solar panels as delivered only recharge the 12-volt lead-acid accessory battery.{{Cite AV media | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=moFQhZ0_-TU?t=13m30s | title=Car and Driver: Tested : 2012 Fisker Karma – Review – CAR and DRIVER | publisher=Car and Driver magazine | date=31 October 2012 | people=Csere, Csaba | authorlink = Csaba Csere | time=13m30s | location=Beverly Hills, CA}} The base model features an "eco-friendly interior", including salvaged/reclaimed [[lumber]]. The interior space is rated as subcompact by the EPA.{{cite web | url=http://news.consumerreports.org/cars/2012/04/fisker-shows-smaller-atlantic-plug-in-hybrid-sedan-in-ny.html | title=Fisker shows smaller Atlantic plug-in hybrid sedan in NY | publisher=[[Consumer Reports]] | work=Consumer News – web | date=6 April 2012 | access-date=14 February 2013 | author=Evarts, Eric}} Optional leather seating is available, but it will use much more of the cow hide than would customarily be found on luxury models; hides with scratches and other marks (which should not affect functionality) will be used.{{cite web |url=http://www.thecarconnection.com/marty-blog/1016887_2010-fisker-karma-vegan-on-board |title=2010 Fisker Karma: Vegan On Board |author=Bengt Halvorson |publisher=thecarconnection.com |date=19 January 2009 |access-date=2011-03-06}} The EcoChic features a natural fabric interior with an ultra-suede dash, as part of Fisker's ecological "animal-free" offering. The Karma has a [[Electric vehicle warning sounds|warning sound system]] designed to both alert pedestrians of its presence and enhance the driver experience. The sound is emitted through a pair of external speakers embedded in the bumper, and the sound-generator was developed by Fisker Automotive.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/14/automobiles/14hybrid.html?_r=2|title=Hybrid Cars May Include Fake Vroom for Safety|publisher=[[New York Times]]|author=Jim Motavalli| date=13 October 2009| access-date=2013-03-21}}{{cite news| url=http://www.economist.com/science/displaystory.cfm?story_id=13606446|title=Electric cars and noise: The sound of silence|publisher=The Economist|date=7 May 2009|access-date=2013-03-21}} The warning sound is emitted automatically and activated only when the car is traveling in [[all-electric mode]] at less than {{convert|25|mph|abbr=on}}.{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/jan/08/autos/la-fi-hy-autos-dot-noise-rules-hybrid-electric-vehicles-20130108 |title=Noise requirements proposed for hybrid and electric vehicles |author=David Undercoffler|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=8 January 2013|access-date=2013-03-21}} ===Performance=== The Karma's two {{convert|201|bhp|PS}} motors produce {{convert|1300|Nm}} of torque, giving the Karma a quoted horsepower of 403 HP.{{cite web |url=http://www.automoblog.net/2009/01/16/detroit-2009-production-fisker-karma-sedan/ |title=Detroit 2009: Production Fisker Karma is revealed, jaws begin dropping |author=Will |date=16 January 2009 |publisher=AutomoBlog |access-date=2009-12-03}}{{cite web |url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/fuel-efficiency/hybrid-technology/fisker-karma2.htm |title=Fisker Karma: Plenty of Torque and Voltage, Too |author=Eric Baxter |date= |publisher=howstuffworks |access-date=2009-12-03}} The Karma features a {{convert|125|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}} top speed and is capable of reaching {{convert|60|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} from a standstill in 6.3 seconds.{{cite web|url=http://whatismycar.com/info/16540/|title=Fisker Karma Technical Specifications|date=21 February 2012}} ==Fuel economy and range== [[File:Fisker Karma EPA label.jpg|thumb|[[Monroney label]] showing EPA's fuel economy and environmental comparison label for the 2012 Fisker Karma]] The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|Environmental Protection Agency]] (EPA) official all-electric range for the Fisker Karma is {{convert|32|mi|abbr=on}} under the agency's five-cycle tests using varying driving conditions and climate controls. EPA's estimated energy consumption is 65 [[kWh]] per 100 miles (1462 [[kilojoule|kJ]]/km). The total range with a full tank of gasoline and a fully charged battery is {{convert|230|mi}}. EPA's official rating for combined city/highway [[fuel economy in automobiles|fuel economy]] in [[all-electric mode]] is 52 [[miles per gallon gasoline equivalent]] (MPG-e) (4.5 L gasoline equivalent/100 km; 62 mpg-imp gasoline equivalent). The EPA rating in gasoline-only mode is {{convert|20|mpgus|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2011/10/karma-20111020.html |title=Fisker Karma EPA-rated at 65 kWh/100 miles on electricity, with 32-mile electric range and 20 mpg US on gasoline|publisher=Green Car Congress|date=20 October 2011|access-date=2011-10-20}} Regarding EPA's rating [[Henrik Fisker]], CEO and co-founder of Fisker Automotive commented that "...as with all electric vehicles, range varies greatly on the conditions of the road and how you drive the car. We firmly believe that most owners will get up to 50 miles of driving range on a single charge."{{cite web|url=http://www.autoguide.com/auto-news/2011/10/fisker-karma-gets-52-mpge-fuel-economy-rating.html|title=Fisker Karma Gets 52 MPGe Fuel Economy Rating|author= Colum Wood|publisher=Auto Guide|date=19 October 2011|access-date=2011-10-19}} The German [[Technischer Überwachungsverein|Technical Inspection Association]] (TÜV) found through independent tests that the Fisker Karma has an all-electric range of {{convert|83|km|abbr=on}} in stealth (all-electric) mode. TÜV found that in [[charge-sustaining]] sport mode the Karma achieves a fuel economy of 26 mpg (9.2 l/100 km). The combined fuel economy was rated at 112 MPG-e (2.1 l/100 km equivalent) and the emissions level is 51 g/km CO2.{{cite web|url=http://www.autoobserver.com/2011/11/fisker-karma-claims-516-mile-electric-range.html|title=Fisker Karma Claims 51.6-Mile Electric Range|author=Scott Doggett|publisher=Edmunds Auto Observer| date=7 November 2011| access-date=2011-11-10}} ''See details in Press Release.''{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2011/11/21/fisker-karma-gets-rated-at-112-mpg-from-europes-tuv/#continued|title=Fisker Karma gets rated at 112 mpg from Europe's TUV|author=Fisker Automotive|publisher=green.autoblog.com|date=21 November 2011|access-date=2011-11-25}} ''See details in Press Release.'' ==Production and delivery== Fisker Automotive and [[Valmet Automotive]] reached agreement in 2008 to manufacture the Karma in [[Uusikaupunki]], [[Finland]],{{cite news | url =http://www.hs.fi/talous/artikkeli/Hybridit+korvaamassa+Porschen+Uudessakaupungissa/1135237888298 | title = Hybridit korvaamassa Porschen | date =15 July 2008 | access-date =2008-07-16 |language=Finnish |newspaper=[[Helsingin Sanomat]]}} with the final assembly contract signed by both parties on 13 November 2008.{{cite web | url = http://www.automotive.com/auto-news/02/39938/index.html | title = Fisker Automotive and Valmet Automotive Have Signed Final Assembly Contract for the... | date = 13 November 2008 | access-date = 2008-11-13 }} [[File:Fisker Karma Interior.JPG|thumb|right|Interior]] In 2008 Fisker Automotive began accepting [[pre-order]]s in the United States, and Europe and initially scheduled sales of its Karma PHEV by the fourth quarter of 2009 in the United States, and starting in 2010 in Europe.{{cite web |url = http://www.autoindustry.co.uk/news/11-04-08_11 |title = Fisker Automotive announces first European importer |date = 11 April 2008 |access-date = 2009-09-14 |publisher = [[Department for Business, Enterprise and Regulatory Reform]] |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://archive.is/20080415000848/http://www.autoindustry.co.uk/news/11-04-08_11 |archivedate = 15 April 2008 |df = dmy-all }} In 2009 Henrik Fisker reported 1,300 orders for the Karma.{{cite web |url=http://www.treehugger.com/files/2009/01/detroit-2009-fisker-automotive-karma-s-sunset-convertible.php |title=Detroit Auto Show 2009: Fisker Unveils Karma S Convertible Plug-In Hybrid |author=Michael Graham Richard |publisher=[[TreeHugger]] |date=11 March 2009 |access-date=2011-03-16}} Henrik Fisker showed the first production model Karma at the 2010 [[Paris Motor Show]].{{cite web |url=http://blogs.edmunds.com/greencaradvisor/2010/09/2010-paris-motor-show-fisker-karma-production-model-hews-to-concepts-promise.html |title=2010 Paris Motor Show: Fisker Karma Production Model Hews to Concept's Promise |author=John O'Dell |date=30 September 2010 |work=Green Car Adviser |publisher=[[Edmunds.com]] |access-date=2010-12-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101004165018/http://blogs.edmunds.com/greencaradvisor/2010/09/2010-paris-motor-show-fisker-karma-production-model-hews-to-concepts-promise.html |archivedate=4 October 2010 |df=dmy-all }} In July 2011, Fisker stated that it had received 3,000 pre-orders and that the plug-in hybrid was sold out until early 2012. After re-scheduling the Karma market launch to September 2010, and missing its target to build 70 to 100 test cars in 2010,{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE64Q11G20100527#|title=Fisker to build 100 test Karma cars in 2010|author=Poornima Gupta| publisher=[[Reuters]]| date=27 May 2010|access-date=2011-03-07}} production began in July 2011, and the two first deliveries took place in the United States during the same month. The [[Valmet Automotive|Valmet plant]] in Finland began production with five cars a week. By December 2011 the production rate was 25 units a day.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-12-22/fisker-seeks-to-lift-karma-sales-to-move-on-from-loan-scrutiny.html|title=Fisker Automotive Seeks to Lift Karma Sales to Move on From Loan Scrutiny|author=Alan Ohnsman|publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]|date=22 December 2011|access-date=2012-01-04}} Production was suspended in November 2012 due to financial difficulties, with about 2,450 Karmas built since 2011. As a result of [[flash flood]]s caused by [[Hurricane Sandy]] in October 2012, 16 Karmas caught fire and another 330 units were lost when an entire shipment from Europe was flooded while being parked at [[Port Newark–Elizabeth Marine Terminal]]. Deliveries to retail customers in the U.S. began in November 2011.{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2011/10/19/fisker-karma-epa-certified-52-mpge-32-mile-electric-range/|title=Fisker Karma gets EPA certified: 52 mpge, 32-mile electric range then 20 mpg|author=Fisker Automotive (press release)|publisher=green.autoblog.com|date=19 October 2011|access-date=2011-10-19}} ''See details in Press Release''. Fisker collected nearly US$200 million until February 2012, when the government froze the loan, because the company was failing to meet the government's milestones. Three months later, in May, Fisker spokesman Robert Ormisher told ABC News that negotiations with the DOE were ongoing, and "We're hoping for a conclusion fairly soon."{{cite news|author= Randy Kreider|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/fisker-recalls-electric-cars/story?id=17044981#.UJKQh7RgPlI|title=Fisker Issues Second Recall of Electric Car|date=12 August 2012|access-date=2012-11-01}} ===''Top Gear''=== The Karma was praised on the British television series ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'' for its looks and hybrid technology while being road-tested by presenter [[James May]] and special guest, [[AC/DC]] front-man [[Brian Johnson]]. Johnson noted that it is probably one of the first production cars that actually looks like the [[concept car|concept version]] that is sketched beforehand, saying, "It's a cracking looking jam-jar". May noticed similarities in the hybrid-powertrain to his own idea that was used in a segment for ''Top Gear'' a few years earlier (The ''Hammerhead Eagle i-Thrust''), though he admits that his idea was very crudely executed. He joked that Fisker would be hearing soon from his lawyers. After his test of the Karma EcoChic, James May awarded it his Top Gear "Car of the Year Award" for 2011[https://www.topgear.com/car-news/usa/tg-awards-2011-james-mays-car-year TG Awards 2011: James May's car of the year]. ==Recalls== In December 2011, Fisker recalled the first 239 Karmas built from July through 3 November 2011, and delivered to the USA, due to a risk of battery fire caused by coolant leak. Of the 239 cars, fewer than fifty had been delivered to customers, the rest were in dealerships, and at that time no car had been involved in a fire. In the report filed by Fisker Automotive with the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA), the carmaker said some hose clamps were not properly positioned, which could allow a coolant leak. "If coolant enters the battery compartment an electrical short could possibly occur, causing a thermal event within the battery, including a possible fire in the [worst] case." The problem was discovered on 16 December at the Valmet Automotive assembly plant in Finland when workers noticed coolant dripping.{{cite news|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/article/20111230/AUTO01/112300333/1148/rss25|title=Fisker recalls plug-in hybrids; EV safety concerns revived |author=David Shepardson|work=[[The Detroit News]]|date=30 December 2011|access-date=2012-01-15}}{{cite news|author= Allan Graubæk|url=http://politiken.dk/tjek/ECE1493453/fiskers-luksusbil-kaldt-retur-i-usa/|title=Fisker's luxury car recalled in USA|work=Politiken|date=30 December 2011|access-date=2011-12-30|language=Danish}}{{cite news|url= http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/12/30/fisker-recalling-239-karma-electric-cars-for-fire-hazard/?ref=automobiles|title=Fisker Recalling 239 Karma Plug-In Hybrids for Fire Hazard |author=Christopher Jensen|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=30 December 2011|access-date=2012-01-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.car-recall.com/Fisker/Karma/2012/92961?|title=2012 Fisker Karma Recall|date=28 December 2011}} On 2 January 2012, Fisker announced that most customer cars and cars stocked in dealerships affected by the recall involving [[A123 Systems]]-supplied battery packs are back in service. The vehicles have either had brand new battery packs installed or the confirmed repair to the hose clamp assembly undertaken. The remaining customers have been contacted and appointments were made for their replacement battery installation.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/01/fisker-20120203.html|title=Fisker says majority of Karma units affected by recall involving battery pack back in service|author=Fisker Press Release|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=3 January 2012|access-date=2012-01-15}} On 18 August 2012, Fisker announced it is recalling about 2,400 Karma plug-in hybrids to repair a faulty cooling fan unit.{{cite news|last=Seetharaman|first=Deepa|title=Automaker Fisker recalls some 2,400 Karmas for cooling fan issue|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/18/us-fisker-karma-idUSBRE87H08H20120818|work=Reuters|access-date=2012-08-18|date= 18 August 2012}} ===''Consumer Reports'' test drive=== On 7 March 2012, a Fisker Karma purchased for US$107,850 by ''[[Consumer Reports]]'' magazine was taken out for a test drive at the {{convert|327|acre|ha|adj=on}} ''CR'' test track facility in Connecticut. The Karma had fewer than {{convert|200|mi|km}} on its odometer. While performing a routine speedometer calibration check prior to actual road testing, the car broke down and could not be restarted. "We buy about 80 cars a year and this is the first time in memory that we have had a car that is undriveable before it has finished our check-in process."{{cite news|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/driveon/post/2012/03/consumer-reports-fisker-karma-breaks/1|title=Consumer Reports' $100K Fisker Karma dies on arrival|author=James R. Retrieved 27 March 2012. ===Fire incidents=== {{See also|Plug-in electric vehicle fire incidents}} A Fisker Karma was involved in a home fire that also burned two other cars in [[Fort Bend County, Texas]] in May 2012. The chief fire investigator said the Karma was the origin of the fire that spread to the house, but the exact cause is still unknown. The [[plug-in electric car]] was not plugged in at the time the fire started and it was reported that the Karma's battery was intact. The carmaker released a public statement saying that there was uncertainty and conflicting reports surrounding the event. Fisker Automotive also stated that the battery pack "does not appear to have been a contributing factor in this incident."{{cite news| url=http://www.autoweek.com/article/20120508/CARNEWS/120509860| title=Official claims Fisker Karma to blame in Texas house fire|author=David Arnouts|work=[[Autoweek]]|date=8 May 2012|access-date=2012-05-09}} The NHTSA is conducting a field inquiry of the incident, and is working with insurance adjusters and Fisker to determine the fire's cause.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-05-18/fisker-karma-fire-in-texas-garage-being-probed-by-nhtsa.html|title=Fisker Karma Fire in Texas Garage Being Probed By NHTSA|author=Angela Greiling Keane|work=[[Bloomberg L.P.]] News|date=18 May 2012|access-date=2012-05-23}} A second fire incident took place in August 2012 when a Karma caught fire while stopped at a parking lot in [[Woodside, California]].{{cite web|last=Lavrinc|first=Damon|title=Another Fisker Karma Goes Up in Flames|url=https://www.wired.com/autopia/2012/08/fisker-karma-fire-part-deux/|publisher=Wired Autopia|date=11 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-12}}{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarreports.com/news/1078412_second-fisker-karma-fire-casts-fresh-doubt-on-plug-in-hybrid|title=Second Fisker Karma Fire Casts Fresh Doubt on Plug-In Hybrid |author=John Voelcker|publisher=Green Car Reports|date=13 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-13}} According to Fisker engineers, the area of origin for the fire was determined to be outside the engine compartment, as the fire was located at the driver's side front corner of the car. The evidence suggested that the ignition source was not the lithium-ion battery pack, new technology components or unique exhaust routing.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/08/fisker-recent-karma-fire-not-caused-by-battery-pack-new-tech-or-exhaust-routing.html|title=Fisker: recent Karma fire not caused by battery pack, new tech or exhaust routing|author=Fisker Automotive Press Release|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=13 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-14}} The investigation conducted by Fisker engineers and an independent fire expert concluded that the cause of the fire was a low temperature cooling fan located at the left front of the Karma, forward of the wheel. An internal fault caused the fan to fail, overheat and started a slow-burning fire. Fisker announced a recall to repair the faulty cooling fan unit.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2012/08/fisker-20120818.html |title=Fisker: Karma fire caused by fault in low-temperature cooling fan; initiates recall|author=Fisker Automotive|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=18 August 2012|access-date=2012-08-19}} In separate incidents during the storm and flooding caused by [[Hurricane Sandy]] on the night of 29 October 2012, 16 Karmas and one [[Toyota Prius Plug-in Hybrid]] caught fire while parked at [[Port Newark-Elizabeth Marine Terminal]]. The vehicles were partially submerged by [[flash flood]]s caused by the hurricane. Initially, a [[Fisker Automotive]] spokesman said the company "''can't be certain exactly what happened at the port''" but "''we think being submerged in 13 feet of saltwater had something to do with it''". The carmaker clarified that the Karmas were not charging at the time of the fire and there were no injuries. In the case of the Toyota's incident, a Prius PHV burned and two other Prius, a conventional hybrid and a plug-in, just smoldered. A Toyota spokeswoman said the fire "''likely started because saltwater got into the electrical system''". She also clarified that the incident affected only three cars out of the 4,000 Toyotas that were at the terminal during the storm, including more than 2,128 plug-in or hybrid models.{{cite news|url=http://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/11/02/mystery-at-port-newark-why-did-17-plug-in-cars-burn/?ef=automobiles|title=Mystery at Port Newark: Why Did 17 Plug-In Cars Burn? |author=Josie Garthwaite|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=2 November 2012|access-date=2012-11-03}}{{cite news|url=http://www.motorauthority.com/news/1080183_fisker-karmas-catch-fire-after-being-submerged-by-hurricane-sandy-flood|title=Fisker Karmas Catch Fire After Being Submerged By Hurricane Sandy Flood|author=Viknesh Vijayenthiran|work=[[Motor Authority]]|date=31 October 2012|access-date=2012-11-03}} After an investigation by Fisker engineers, witnessed by NHTSA representatives, the company said that the origin of the fire was "''residual salt damage inside a Vehicle Control Unit submerged in seawater for several hours. Corrosion from the salt caused a short circuit in the unit, which led to a fire when the Karma's 12-Volt battery fed power into the circuit''". The company explained that Sandy's heavy winds spread that fire to other Karmas parked nearby, and also ruled out the vehicles' lithium-ion battery packs as a cause of, or even a contributing factor to, the blaze.{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarreports.com/news/1080276_sandy-flood-fire-followup-fisker-karma-battery-not-at-fault|title=Sandy Flood Fire Followup: Fisker Karma Battery Not At Fault|author=John Voelcker|publisher=Green Car Reports|date=6 November 2012|access-date=2012-11-07}} Fisker reported a loss of around 330 additional Karmas when an entire shipment from Europe was flooded in the port terminal, the estimated value of the flood loss is in excess of {{US$|30}} million.{{cite web|url=http://www.hybridcars.com/news/fisker-exonerated-after-hurricane-induced-karma-330-more-destroyed-59222.ht|title=Hurricane-Induced Fires; Reports 330 More Destroyed|author=Pete Brissette|publisher=hybridcars.com|date=7 November 2012|access-date=2012-11-18}} ===Celebrity crash=== Guitarist [[Carlos Santana]] made the news 20 September 2013 when he wrecked his Fisker Karma in [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]] after falling asleep at the wheel and hitting two parked cars. No one was injured.{{cite web|url=http://www.tmz.com/2013/09/18/carlos-santana-car-crash-accident-las-vegas-fell-asleep-wheel-photo/|title=Carlos Santana's Car Totaled in Vegas Crash -- Asleep at Wheel|publisher=}} ===Tesla lawsuit=== On 14 April 2008, [[Tesla Motors]] filed a lawsuit against Fisker Automotive, alleging that Henrik Fisker stole Tesla's [[Tesla Model S|Model S]] hybrid technology and was using it to develop the Karma. Tesla's suit claimed that the design work done for the Model S sedan by [[Fisker Coachbuild]] was substandard, and that Fisker Automotive diverted its best ideas to the Karma. {{cite news | last = Migliore | first = Greg | title = Tesla sues Fisker, alleges theft of trade secrets | newspaper = [[AutoWeek]] | date = 16 April 2008 | url = http://www.autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/200804161045/FREE/512789873 | access-date = 2008-04-16 }} On 4 November 2008 [[CNET Networks#CNET News|CNET News]] reported that Tesla Motors would discontinue its suit after an interim ruling in favor of Fisker et al. {{cite web | last = LaMonica | first = Martin | title = Tesla Motors loses trade secrets case against Fisker | work = [[CNET Networks#CNET News|CNET News]] | date = 11 April 2008 | url = http://news.cnet.com/8301-11128_3-10082062-54.html?tag=mncol | access-date = 2009-06-29 }} A news release on the Fisker Automotive website stated that Tesla was ordered to pay US$1,144,285 in costs.{{cite web |title=ARBITRATOR FIRM EARLIER FINDING IN FAVOR OF FISKER AND AWARDS FISKER $1,144,385 |publisher=[[Fisker Automotive]] |url=http://karma.fiskerautomotive.com/news_items/download/5/2008-12-11.pdf |format=PDF |access-date=2009-09-14 |date=11 December 2008 }} ==Related models== ==={{anchor|Fisker Sunset}}Fisker Sunset=== [[File:Fisker Sunset--DC.jpg|thumb|Fisker Sunset]] Fisker previewed the Karma S "Sunset", which is based on the regular Karma, at the [[North American International Auto Show|2012 North American International Auto Show]], Fisker has said that the Sunset only has minimum weight increases, when compared with the Karma. Overall weight on the Surf versus the Karma increases by just {{convert|77|lb}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2011/09/13/fisker-surf-shooting-brake-wows-frankfurt-show/|title=Fisker Surf shooting brake wows Frankfurt Show |author=Matt Davis |publisher=green.autoblog.com|date=13 September 2011 |access-date=2011-09-15}} ===VLF Automotive's VLF Destino=== {{Main|VLF Destino}} Retired General Motors Vice-Chairman [[Bob Lutz (businessman)|Bob Lutz]] and his business partner [[Gilbert Villarreal]] announced the debut of [[VL Automotive]] at the 2013 [[North American International Auto Show]]. The award went to [[Fisker Automotive]] for the Fisker Karma Sunset.{{cite web |url=http://www.allcarselectric.com/blog/1021718_fisker-karma-sunset-named-2009-north-american-production-preview-vehicle-of-the-year |title=Fisker Karma Sunset Named 2009 North American Production Preview Vehicle of the Year |last=Scardino |first=Robert|date=24 June 2009| access-date=2009-09-14| publisher=AllCarsElectric.com}}{{cite web |url=http://news.prnewswire.com/ViewContent.aspx?ACCT=109&STORY=/www/story/06-23-2009/0005049205&EDATE=|title=Fisker Plug-In Hybrid Wins North American Concept Vehicle of the Year Award Category|publisher=[[Fisker Automotive]] |date=23 June 2009|access-date=2009-09-14}} The Fisker Karma was listed among the "Green Design 100" of 2009 by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1892751_1892571_1892576,00.html|title=The Green Design 100 – Transportation: Fisker Karma |author=Mengly Taing|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=24 April 2009|access-date=2011-11-24}} Also, Time listed the Karma among "The 50 Best Inventions" of 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,2099708,00.html|title=The 50 Best Inventions – The Fun Electric Car|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=28 November 2011|access-date=2011-11-24}} ''See page 76 of the 28 November print edition''.
